cluster_images.convert module

cluster_images.convert.KMeans_Elbow(data, cluster_range=(2, 100))[source]
Apply KMeans to data cluster_range[1]-cluster_range[0] times.

Compute and plot cluster distortions for each cluster count in cluster_range. Predict optimal cluster count based on the elbow method.

Parameters

  • data (ndarray) – A nxp sized NumPy array of data to apply KMeans clustering to.

  • cluster_range (tuple[int, int]) – The range of clusters of consider for KMeans and analysis. Defaults to (2,100).

More information on the KElbowVisualizer and arguments available can be found here:

https://www.scikit-yb.org/en/latest/api/cluster/elbow.html

cluster_images.convert.KMeans_clustering(data, n_clusters=45)[source]

Apply KMeans clustering to data using n_clusters clusters.

Parameters

  • data (ndarray) – A nxp sized NumPy array.

  • n_clusters (int) – The number of clusters to use in the KMeans algorithm. Defaults to 45.

Returns

A trained KMeans model on data using n_clusters clusters. A (data.shape[0],) sized NumPy array denoting the cluster number each datapoint is assigned to.

Return type

A tuple containing

cluster_images.convert.load_dataset(dir='caltech-101/101_ObjectCategories/', image_size=(96, 96), batch_size=32)[source]

Loads the Caltech-101 Dataset downloaded in directory dir.

Parameters

  • dir (str) – The directory where the caltech-101 dataset is stored. Defaults to ‘caltech-101/101_ObjectCategories/’.

  • image_size (tuple[int, int]) – The width and height of images to rescale directory dataset to.

  • batch_size (int) – The size of batches. Change depending on computational performance.

Return type

DatasetV2

Returns

A Tensorflow BatchDataset.

cluster_images.convert.normalise_features(features)[source]

Normalise descriptor features to have mean = 0 and sd = 1.

Parameters

hogs – A nxp sized NumPy array of HOG descriptors.

Returns

A nxp sized NumPy array of HOG descriptors with normalised features.

Return type

np.ndarray

cluster_images.convert.reduce_with_LLE(data, n_components=50)[source]

Do Locally Linear Embedding on data, keeping the top n_components.

Parameters

  • data (ndarray) – A nxp sized NumPy array of data to do PCA with. Features are assumed to be normalised. The Euclidean distance metric is used.

  • n_components (int) – The number of most varied features to keep. Defaults to 50.

Return type

ndarray

Returns

A nxn_components sized NumPy array of PCA reduced data.

cluster_images.convert.reduce_with_PCA(data, n_components=50)[source]

Do PCA on data, keeping the top n_components.

Parameters

  • data (ndarray) – A nxp sized NumPy array of data to do PCA with. Features are assumed to be normalised. The Euclidean distance metric is used.

  • n_components (int) – The number of most varied features to keep. Defaults to 50.

Return type

ndarray

Returns

A nxn_components sized NumPy array of PCA reduced data.

cluster_images.convert.reduce_with_Spectral(data, n_components=50)[source]

Do Spectral Embedding on data, keeping the top n_components.

Parameters

  • data (ndarray) – A nxp sized NumPy array of data to do PCA with. Features are assumed to be normalised. The Euclidean distance metric is used.

  • n_components (int) – The number of most varied features to keep. Defaults to 50.

Return type

ndarray

Returns

A nxn_components sized NumPy array of PCA reduced data.
